website_summaries.verdict: Low price point for a popular camera rain cover that's transparent in the back so you can see the display screen easily.
pros: Fits mid- and small-sized DSLRs nicely
Includes sleeves along the side so you can reach the buttons without exposing the camera to rain
Uses a double zipper configuration on the bottom, so you can use the cover successfully whether you're hand-holding the camera or using a tripod
cons: Not quite as durable as some other materials
Fits fewer cameras than other models

customer_reviews.title: Clear plastic window fogged up over time. Replaced by seller at no cost.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these a little over a year ago. I kept them in a dry plastic bin to store in my office until I needed them. I was very disappointed to see that the clear panel had gone from clear to a milky white. Although they are still usable, they are difficult to see through now which make setting the camera rather tricky. **UPDATE** Replaced at no cost by the seller. Great customer service!! They stand behind their products.
customer_reviews.author: Thomasbeau

customer_reviews.title: Only OK while brand new.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this cover for about 1 1/2 years now. I have used it only twice. The 2nd time I got it out I was very disappointed. The clear areas had turned VERY cloudy. I was unable to see my camera buttons because visibility was so poor. It also has a poorly designed lens sleeve in that even after tightening the sleeve onto the lens it comes loose constantly and became useless. Sad too since I was attempting shooting a heavy waterfall at Yosemite National Park.
customer_reviews.author: fishhook

customer_reviews.title: Good thing this cheap
customer_reviews.text: Delivered as promised. Finally opened and used today February 10. Canvas material is good and I like the drawstrings. The clear plastic is cheap. Took it out in cold weather and was very stiff to the point where if you fold it it has the potential of cracking or Tearing. This is likely made for warmer weather and primarily for rain. It does the job in keeping my equipment dry including the lens, but this model is actually made for a shorter lengths of less than 600 mm.
customer_reviews.author: Todd M. Grivetti

customer_reviews.title: The Postman (Rain, sleet or snow)
customer_reviews.text: Man, I love this thing! It does a very good job. The way I use it is that I put my strap through the left hand slot and then I use my right hand slot for the normal stuff. It does not accommodate small prime lenses very well, but you can make it work. Not a show stopper. But over been shooting primarily in southern Italy for the last month and it has been non stop raining. I have been using this cover very consitistantly You will need to account for fog, just like your windshield. But it’s not serious. Overall I have shot multiple times in the rain and this has been great.
customer_reviews.author: joseph

customer_reviews.title: Moisture Protection for Your Camera
customer_reviews.text: I'm extremely pleased with this rain cover for my camera. I typically pair my Nikon Z6 with FTZ mount and 200-500 mm telephoto lens and this rain cover handles both easily and comfortably. It is especially useful when on a small boat in the ocean, where ocean spray can occur and would normally be damaging to the camera and optics. The transparent back makes it easy to use the viewfinder or rear display while keeping the camera dry.the two side openings are easy to put your hands inside and you can set up a camera strap to run through these openings. A great way to keep your camera dry on rainy or drizzly days.
customer_reviews.author: Harvey S. Trop

customer_reviews.title: A Must Have For Any Outdoor/Nature Photographer!
customer_reviews.text: Used this rain cover all over Iceland in the winter, and again in Ireland, Scotland, and England during the rainy season. It kept my Nikon safe and dry! I coupled it with a wireless shutter remote and it is even easier to take pictures in the rain and snow. The fabric and construction is extremely durable, as I took it all over in my suitcase, camera bag, or carry on. I haven't had any issues with leaks or tears. It is an awesome product for anyone who shoots in the rain. I will be taking it with me this year to Indonesia as well!
customer_reviews.author: fenderguy91r

customer_reviews.title: Too stiff
customer_reviews.text: It is too stiff to use well over a lens. The pull cord at the front gathers too much over smaller lenses, making it not very effective against water leaking back onto the lens under the barrier. The clear plastic bit to see the controls was not as easy to see through as it could be. Thankfully I have the controls memorized so this is not huge, but till it would be much better if you could see better from it. I went back to my large plastic bag that I can just duck in and out of as I use it. .2c and more effective.
customer_reviews.author: Obsidian

customer_reviews.title: Camera Raincoat
customer_reviews.text: This is a very well-made product it's an excellent product for the price. I am very happy with it I can see through the clear plastic with very little distortion. My automatic Focus can move freely because of the adjustable strap around the lens. My hands fit comfortably on the camera through the arms provided for by the raincoat. There's plenty of room for a professional camera Canon or Nikon.
customer_reviews.author: Bunny

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.......Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I was able to test this rain cover out right after I received it in a heavy downpour. It works as advertised and I had no problems other than the fogging up issue reported by other reviewers and getting the cover to cinch up around the lens was a bit tricky but I was able to manage it with a little extra effort. I liked that the access openings can be cinched up to protect the camera when you are not actually shooting, such as when you are just carrying the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Yahart53

customer_reviews.title: Best Accessory Yet!
customer_reviews.text: This thing was amazing in Alaska! Whether it was dew drops or full on rain storm, it passed the test. This works best with a lens hood but I used it without one just the same. It shielded my hands from the elements which helped tremendously to cut down the cold winds. Camera stayed dry and I had so many people asking me where I got it. Definitely recommend to anyone shooting in elements involving minor precipitation to full on storm. Easy to use, easy to adjust, and easy to remove. I used it without a tripod as I handheld my Canon 5D Mark III.
customer_reviews.author: Betterfli

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to my camera bag.
customer_reviews.text: Initial review (will update after further use): I bought this for a trip I will be taking next week, since it's raining today I opted to take it for a test run, it was easy to bring down to secure on my shorter lens (50mm), I was able to see via the view finder perfectly, got a few crisp shots of leaves for the test, it's definitely a big enough cover for my long range lens. I'm very happy I purchased this, it will come in very handy at the beach next week.
customer_reviews.author: Mouse

customer_reviews.title: I like the fit for my Nikon FX - it's long ...
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for alternatives to protect my camera joints from sand and salt spray at the beach. This arrived within days of my order, was exactly as described, and inexpensive enough that I could purchase it for a trial run without breaking the bank. I like the fit for my Nikon FX - it's long enough for my 300mm lens - and looks like it will do the trick. The seller emailed to make sure it arrived on time and there were no problems with the order. You can't ask for more than that. .
customer_reviews.author: Been There Done That

customer_reviews.title: Durable Rain Cover
customer_reviews.text: I liked the first Altura rain cover so much, I needed another to protect my second camera. I have used the rain cover in the rain of Denali and the dust of Botswana. Fabric sleeves on either side allow hands to operate the camera. The front cover is long enough for a 100-400 lens and secures the front with a Velcro wrap. It looks so good, people stop and ask what it is and where they can get one. Much better and durable than the flimsy plastic ones that wind up ripping at inopportune times.
customer_reviews.author: DH

customer_reviews.title: Must have to protect your camera in the rain. ...
customer_reviews.text: Must have to protect your camera in the rain. Takes a while getting used to, I actually have found its easier for me to not close the bottom and bring my hands up through their verses using the hand sleeves, but that's just me. Sometime is a little tough when the clear plastic fogs up, this seems less when its not all closed up and you don't use the hand holes
customer_reviews.author: SG

customer_reviews.title: FITS GREAT AND WATERPROOF PROTECTION!
customer_reviews.text: Used it to cover my GH5. It's easy to access the camera controls even though it's covered. Also super easy to install. It kept my camera safe and dry for an outdoor wedding shoot. The wedding was delayed due to the rain and we didn't want to move from our set locations. So I just covered the cameras and walked away. Came back after the rain subsided and the camera didn't have a drop of water on it. Worked amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Jaime

customer_reviews.title: Something that you don't know you need
customer_reviews.text: This is one of those products that you don't know you need until you actually need it. There isn't really anything special about it..it just works. However you tend to feel differently if you actually need one and don't have it. It's plastic and protects everything that I need it to protect. It fits fairly well..not perfect but it's manageable. Overall i'd recommend this if you do any shooting in the rain..or even if you don't :)
customer_reviews.author: Keyser RevealTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Don’t get it unless you shoot with tripod all the time
customer_reviews.text: It is solid built however it is not for those who shoot without Tripod. There is NO WAY you can use it with camera hanging from your neck. And you MUST use a hood on the lense otherwise this cover will cover part of the frame. I don’t like it at all but didn’t try it on time so now it’s past one month return period. Oh well.
customer_reviews.author: Chih Yen

customer_reviews.title: You gotta have this for your equipment!
customer_reviews.text: I love this protector! I use a 5D Mark II with Tamaron 24-70mm & 70-200mm and this covers it completely! It’s very easy to put on and though I have not tried outside yet (just got it today) but, as soon as I get a chance I will try it and I’m confident it will work perfect. With the cold weather here in the northwest, I am expecting the clear vinyl cover to fog up a bit but, it looks like it will keep my gear very dry from water and snow. Not sure why I didn’t look into this before.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis H

customer_reviews.title: I really liked that this was able to help me keep my ...
customer_reviews.text: I really liked that this was able to help me keep my gear dry, however wish there was a way to allow the strap to come through the back. I was using it in Iceland where there is rain or you're bound to be sprayed by a waterfall at some point, I wished I could have the strap around my neck just for extra safety and assurance the camera wouldn't slip out of my hand.
customer_reviews.author: Donna LaV.

customer_reviews.title: Saved the day
customer_reviews.text: Yesterday was the first time using this product even though I have had it for awhile. I was taking photos for a high school track meet. The weather was horrible. Damp and rainy the entire day with times of down pours. The rain cover kept my camera dry. The only minor issue was the clear section on the cover to see the camera display did fog up a little but not enough to cause problems. I would recommend this product to others. Without this cover I would not have been able to take photos during the nasty weather.
customer_reviews.author: petecrysTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Safe from rain
customer_reviews.text: If you need something that will make your camera safe from rain this is it, I used it under light rain and did the job perfect, I was able to keep my gear dry and still be able to take pictures. It is a little messy when you take it off and clean up but once you get a hold of it then it gets easy. it fits anywhere in your bag.
customer_reviews.author: ernesto v.

customer_reviews.title: Does the job....
customer_reviews.text: Fits my camera with a 100-400 lens easily. Your view finder is also covered by this shield which can make focusing a little difficult. Add to the progressive glasses and sometimes I prayed I got the shot. So far, I’ve trusted my auto focus and have not been disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: SRC Photography

customer_reviews.title: Good product design.
customer_reviews.text: Love this cover, would like more length maybe even a material that is more flexable. for the lense section so it can move as you set different focal lengths for those that have lenses that will extend physically when adjusting focal lengths. I have bought a few items from this company and have not been disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey

customer_reviews.title: Good design but clear plastic panel needs to be better
customer_reviews.text: I have used it for a couple of days taking pictures at the water fall. I used a towel to dry it after each use and hung out to dry. I really like the design and how it protects the camera. One thing that must improve is the clear plastic panel became foggy after about 3 months. I washed it with water and then again with very light dish washing detergent. No help. Now it it really hard to see the LCD and some camera controls.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Practical
customer_reviews.text: While it is weird at first, this UFO-looking thing will save your equipment many, many times- spacey enough, intelligently built, and fun to use, this is a great alternative than getting your equipment wet and paying thousands of dollars for repairs or new equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Koko

customer_reviews.title: Good for tripod work in the rain
customer_reviews.text: It’s pretty helpful depending on what you’re shooting. Only good for tripod work. To awkward for walking around and using it. It kept my camera dry on a long mountain nature shoot in the rain. I could see my screen easily to take photos.
customer_reviews.author: I Caruana

customer_reviews.title: Saved me on outdoor shoots more than once
customer_reviews.text: My body and lenses are waterproof but I don’t like testing fate. I’ve shot some outdoor sports in torrential downpours. The plastic will fog up making it difficult to see through but there’s not much that can be done about that. It’s a sacrifice that I’m willing to make to keep my equipment dry.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hooker

customer_reviews.title: perfect for Ireland!
customer_reviews.text: After reading a few articles on the unpredictable weather in Ireland I wanted to be prepared with my DSL. It rained or drizzled every day at some point in the Fall. However, this rain cover was great! It was easy to use and I was able to get some great photos in the drizzle (great for me anyway).
customer_reviews.author: cece

customer_reviews.title: Good when you love photography and rain starts
customer_reviews.text: This is something I was looking for after being caught in a rainstorm as I was hiking (I enjoy photography, so this was a frustration for me .. rain on the camera and lens) I'd say use a lens hood like as pictured here .. (I don't like to crop my images .. so a lens hood is a must) This might be a bit more uncomfortable as the arthritis gets worse though .. (the hand space is not exactly going to accommodate the stiffness of arthritis)
customer_reviews.author: An Empty-Nester

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: Awesome design, does what it is supposed to do. The clear plastic is extremely scratch resistant and completely waterproof. If it ever fails, I would still purchase it again UPDATE A year later. The clear plexiglass doesn’t hold up in the winter, after folding it just cracked and has holes where the fold lines are. Temps at 25f and 20f degrees are hard on this cover.
customer_reviews.author: BigBobbyD

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when I was planning my vacation to Niagara Falls and I wanted pictures of water up close but didn’t want my camera to get damage in the process. Well it worked so well, my camera was protected. My only complaint was that the clear plastic part fogged up after a while and I wasn’t able to see what I was taking a picture of.
customer_reviews.author: Candase

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work for my mirror less Sony’s
customer_reviews.text: The sensor gets confused inside this case and shutter release doesn’t work. Basically can’t take pictures when camera is inside the case so it was a waste of $ for me. I have two Sony’s both new and work great outside of this case.
customer_reviews.author: kittyma

customer_reviews.title: Does what it needs to do.
customer_reviews.text: There are plenty of more expensive examples of this kind of product, but for the price this does what I need of it. I would not recommend using it in a torrential downpour with gusting winds, but then I wouldn't suggest taking a DSLR out in those conditions without an underwater casing anyway. For a light drizzle, this will keep your camera (especially ones that are already fully or partially sealed) fully protected. Don't forget to use a UV lens filter to protect your precious glass! ;)
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Hochberg

customer_reviews.title: So-So
customer_reviews.text: It does the job but it is cumbersome to work with and one of the biggest problems I had was manually focusing a lens. Hey for $13 you're not going to lose out but you still may regret it. I still use it but I'm definitely in the market for something better.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Bussey

customer_reviews.title: How to clean the plastic clear panel
customer_reviews.text: The clear plastic window clouded over after a couple of years making it unusable. I had a bottle of Novus #1 cleaner and after scrubbing with a soft cloth and the Novus spray, not only cleared it but also made it more flexible. No problems other than that.
customer_reviews.author: A. B. Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Kept my gear dry and was still able to shoot effectively.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to protect my gear when photographing high school soccer matches on the rain. Takes some getting used to and I only use it when I really need to. But definitely waterproof and kept my camera and lens dry despite driving rain in several matches during the fall season (we did not have great weather luck this Fall).
customer_reviews.author: Robert Burmaster

customer_reviews.title: I was SOOOO excited for this thing, it was ...
customer_reviews.text: I was SOOOO excited for this thing, it was ridiculous. I bought it specifically for a Sony A77 with a zoom lens to use while traveling in Europe and Asia. It spontaneously rains a lot where I went. And this thing failed hard. I mean HARD. I couldn't get the zipper to stay closed. I couldn't keep the cover on the lens or the lens hood. This whole thing was MASSIVE compared to my camera.
customer_reviews.author: KhouriTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Easy access side sleeves make camera operation easy and convenient
customer_reviews.text: Anti-slip lens grip and Velcro tightening mechanism make attaching to and keeping the cover in place a snap. Easy access side sleeves make camera operation easy and convenient. Large viewing window allows for making camera adjustments quickly and easily. Slight trade-off for full cover protection - no cutout for view finder. This makes for superior protection from the elements - but can make viewing and focusing on your subject a bit of a challenge. Heavy weight nylon also provides excellent protection - but is bulkier and requires more space than lighter weight and more compact covers. Overall, a solid cover for the travel and outdoor photographer for whom space is not the primary consideration.
customer_reviews.author: S. Gillespie

customer_reviews.title: Fun to use, even if you look kinda funny walking around with it
customer_reviews.text: This rain cover works. Took my new camera to Scotland a few weeks ago and it was drizzly and rainy for parts of the time. I was able to comfortable have my camera out and was able to take photos thanks to this cover. Only thing that I have to mention is that the clear part of the cover does fog up making it difficult to view the screen. Other than that, I am pretty happy with this rain cover.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Gonzales

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Not sure anything would have been easier to use; but I really cannot complain about the convenience or fit of this sleeve. Protected my camera and that was the purpose. Well made. I probably won’t ever have to purchase another.
customer_reviews.author: Jill W.

customer_reviews.title: Review after two years, a disposable item
customer_reviews.text: After two years of occasional use, I have two basic complaints. The see through plastic is of poor quality and has degenerated to opaque and cracked and separated along the stitch lines. It was cleaned after use every time I used it. The sealing system around the lens hood is problematical, I never could get a good seal with a zoom lens. For the price it is almost a one off use system, almost a disposable item. The concept is good but the execution of the design has major flaws in material (the clear plastic) and the lens sealing system (I did look at all the YouTube videos for suggestions)
customer_reviews.author: Docker

customer_reviews.title: Kept my camera dry on Everest Trek
customer_reviews.text: Took this to Nepal for trek to Everest Base Camp. Came in handy as we had rain and snow. Worked Fine. Camera never got wet. Only downside was it didn't fold up to a small size. But would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: KAL In GilbertAZ

customer_reviews.title: It works but not practical for actual rain use
customer_reviews.text: This fits and will block rain, even heavy rain, but my issue is that the clear plastic fogs up very easily in the rain and it doesn't have a hole to put through/around the viewfinder, so you can't see through it when it's foggy.
customer_reviews.author: A.M.

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased a few days prior to vacationing in Peru with limited time to sort through all of the available products. The Altura rain cover worked great with my Nikon D90 and Tamron 18-270mm lens and held up well during the rain at Machu Picchu and The Amazon jungle. The Altura rain cover will need some slight adjustments if using a telephoto lens. I would recommend having a small size clip or cord to hold the zippers closed if using with a camera clip on a backpack or camelback. Great product for the price - highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Redti2go

customer_reviews.title: This was a big hit while traveling
customer_reviews.text: This rain cover saved my camera while we were traveling overseas since it rained often where we were touring. Everyone in our tour group wished they had this rain cover. I really like the rubber grip at the lens opening and the velcro because it keeps the rain cover in place.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Southward

customer_reviews.title: Awkward But Useful
customer_reviews.text: I have the Canon T5 Rebel and this rain cover is actually a bit big and confusing (didn't come with any instructions or helpful tips how to use it) and hard to use for taking photos since you have to look Through the plastic to then see into the view finder And I wear glasses which made it more difficult. However, all that being said, it kept my camera dry through the photo set in the rain - and at the end of the day that's all I needed it to do so it did it's job.
customer_reviews.author: Luscious

customer_reviews.title: Great Protection for your Camera
customer_reviews.text: This rain cover provides excellent protection for your camera. The large viewing area allows for easy access to the controls and making any adjustments. The hand openings are large enough to move around the camera without restriction.
customer_reviews.author: Mork from Ork

customer_reviews.title: The material its made of is a bit stiff, ...
customer_reviews.text: The clear plastic view square on this is terrible. After 2 uses in weather it became cloudy and no amount of cleaning it will cure it. Stayed cloudy afterwards. The bottom wants to re-open all the time allowing your hands to get wet. The drawstring does not secure tightly to the lens, causing it to "ride up" on the lens body due to the stiffness of the material.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Adams

customer_reviews.title: This is cheap insurance
customer_reviews.text: It’s a pretty basic product which makes it nice. It’s pretty easy to use, it seems that the camera goes in pretty easily, and more. I haven’t yet used it in hard rain but it gave no problems during Spring & Summer showers.
customer_reviews.author: Webpager

customer_reviews.title: Almost a 5
customer_reviews.text: Seems well built and seemed to protect the cameras. No real instructions on how to seal around the lens with the velcro strap - I'm still not sure if I've hooked it up properly. I wished there was more room inside the main compartment for my hands to work. Plus it got so hot and humid inside that the backs of my hands kept sticking to the back on the clear window. It would have got 5 stars if it had better instructions and had a bit more room in there.
customer_reviews.author: P. Buchanan

customer_reviews.title: Just what I need for rainy days
customer_reviews.text: I love to use this when I go down to the beach or on rainy days in addition. I also do a little extra I treat my rain cover with plastic water repellent by rain X I also keep a shim cloth inside the rain cover
customer_reviews.author: TomF

customer_reviews.title: Good protection
customer_reviews.text: It gives good protection to the camera but i find it really complicated and slow to get to the controls to shoot. I wish it was easier because it gives good protection. I only used it once and don't think i will take it out again.
customer_reviews.author: FranciscoV

customer_reviews.title: Cost effective weather protection
customer_reviews.text: Good quality materials and well made. Folds easily for compact storage. The only negative is that it comes with tissue to protect the clear plastic viewing window, I now use a microfiber cleaning cloth since it will last longer and keeps the cloth handy. It's a very cost effective solution to rain protection.
customer_reviews.author: Jim905

customer_reviews.title: Glad I Had It
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this rain cover recently before a trip to Iceland. Other travelers had noted the importance of being prepared for rainy weather. Right they were! I was SO glad I had this cover. Indeed, it rained on and off almost every day but because I had the cover I a) kept my camera dry (and my hands a little warmer), b) got some great photos despite the rain and c) ended up enjoying the vacation more because I wasn't thinking about all the photos I was missing because of the rain. I will definitely be taking the cover with me on other trips. A solid investment.
customer_reviews.author: goldenmesa

customer_reviews.title: SL2 owners, DONT BUY THIS!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Canon SL2 but this is way way way bigger for the camera. As you know, Sl2 is very very small and compact unlike regular sized dslrs. So i'm unable to use this item.
customer_reviews.author: Fadaboey

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put on
customer_reviews.text: Southern California doesn't always lend toward the need for a rain cover, however, when rain is in the forecast for a wedding day...you purchase a rain cover. This cover is legit in a pinch. Easy to put on, easy to navigate the camera buttons while inside the cover, camera stayed safe. Win, win for all.
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: This thing really came in handy when on a boat ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing really came in handy when on a boat trying to take pictures of whales, in the rain. The only difficulty I had is looking through the view finder to the point it became a point and shot game after a while.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Raindrops keep falling on my head...
customer_reviews.text: Have not had opportunity to use yet but design seems sound and construction is durable. Have used many products by same company before and have not been disappointed at all with quality, durability, and ease of use. Looking forward to utilizing soon.
customer_reviews.author: frontrowesports

customer_reviews.title: Not as useful as hoped
customer_reviews.text: I have a Nikon D600, and this was really difficult to get in place with it. I liked that it had two openings for your arms so you could still focus and shoot as usual, but this cover was awkward to use and it was constantly sliding over the front of my lens. I only used it twice, then gave up and just put my camera away when it rained. It's a good concept, but would be better if made for specific camera models rather than using the one size fits all approach.
customer_reviews.author: speak04

customer_reviews.title: Too rigid to be worth using.
customer_reviews.text: The biggest problem with this cover is that it's very stiff so the camera has trouble auto focusing with it on. Small lenses it just pops off the end. Fits my 75-300 fine but don't bother trying to zoom in or out. It's incredibly difficult to adjust the zoom and the bag will pop off if you zoom out too far.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Pickens

customer_reviews.title: this thing would be absolutely perfect for damp conditions up to light rain
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this to use on a recent vacation where water misting and rain might become a problem. Our only problem was that the tube for the lens was much too long to use with the small, basic lens that we took with us. Tried folding it inside out a bit but just couldn't get the length right. Our mistake really so I'm not letting that detract from my rating. I did manage to get it properly fitted with a slightly larger lens. Coupled with a lens cover and hood, this thing would be absolutely perfect for damp conditions up to light rain. Just so everyone understands, we used a Canon EOS 70D with the 18-55mm Canon lens.
customer_reviews.author: CJ Pugh

customer_reviews.title: A must if you take sports picture
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my wife as she takes pictures for the local high school sports. It is a must if you are outside. There is disposal ones that she used in the past but this is MUCH better. I think three other people purchased them that week that snap shots with her.
customer_reviews.author: James E Ballengee II

customer_reviews.title: I travel for a living so this was a perfect addition to my already large camera arsenal
customer_reviews.text: I travel for a living so this was a perfect addition to my already large camera arsenal. It went perfectly with my hand grip (Prost Leather Hand Grip Strap for Canon). Really like how it kept the camera and my hands dry all thru snow, rain weather. Easy to pack and easy to dry afterwards. the drawstring is great as it allows the lens to move, and the clear plastic cover stays clear - doesn't fog up.. really happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: LP

customer_reviews.title: Scorpios Review: Very worth it for the price
customer_reviews.text: Although I am worried seeing through the window won't be easy with a tripod, and said window did fog up on me multiple times; the cover worked like a charm. A Must have for rainy days. Easy to use and kept my camera clean and my video and pictures clear through the rain.
customer_reviews.author: comedianmasta

customer_reviews.title: A BIT BULKY
customer_reviews.text: IT S BIT BULKY.. FOR MY HAND AND CAMERA I JUST COULD NOT GET IT TO WORK RIGHT.. HARD TO SEE THROUGH THE PLASTIC. ITS MADE BERY WELL AND FOR SOME OTHER CAMERA AND LENS MAYBE IT WOULD DO BETTER.. NIKON
customer_reviews.author: Patty

customer_reviews.title: Nice to have it
customer_reviews.text: I used this for the Holi Festival to cover my camera. It worked pretty well, although the powder still got in some, but it’s better than the shopping bags.
customer_reviews.author: cchenhou

customer_reviews.title: Spend more money and get something better
customer_reviews.text: I have a 700 mm telephoto lens. Wanted to protect it from rain of course. This is a hard to use semi rigid piece of plastic supported by a flimsy plastic support. Ended up not using it. No worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon A.

customer_reviews.title: Bulky / Velco Heaven
customer_reviews.text: If you like bulk, and velco instantaneously out this in your checkout bag. I found it hard to use since my main lenses are vintage manual ones it was a bit difficult to focus. However if your main purpose is to point and shoot in Auto it's worth the money. I am sure it will save my camera and lenses however for how bulky it is it was a headache to deal with in the rain, only time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Madison F.

customer_reviews.title: Just What I Needed
customer_reviews.text: I finally found what I need for my camera in inclement weather. I had been using a large zip lock bag which was awkward and clumsy. This is just what the doctor ordered!
customer_reviews.author: Denise B.

customer_reviews.title: Kept My Gear Dry, But Using The Camera Was Tough
customer_reviews.text: This rain cover was pretty decent. It kept my camera dry, but the plastic to covers the viewfinder and screen on the back of the camera proved to be problematic when the rain started to pour. At some point, I had to switch to using the review screen as my viewfinder. The plastic got cloudy, or the rain just seemed to "stick" to the plastic, which meant that ensuring pin-sharp focus was nearly impossible. In the end, it was better having this cover than not, because it kept my gear dry. However, the tradeoffs with being able to effectively use my camera made it something that I cannot recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew L.

customer_reviews.title: OK for that special photographer
customer_reviews.text: I'll be fair to this device... since I haven't used it yet, but have pulled it from it's packaging and tested it on my Nikon DSLR. Will I ever use it? I don't know since I'm more of a traveling camera guy and don't even like lugging around my big camera, as a tourist. It may be more useful for a different kind of photographer. I'm more of a "catch-images-for-memory" type of person, attempting some composition and artwork. I also edit most of my memories in some way to enhance images, which I then call, "slides".
customer_reviews.author: plum_1000

customer_reviews.title: quality is good for the price
customer_reviews.text: very easy to use and even tho i haven’t used it yet i can’t wait because I have seen someone use it and it works really well if a photogrpaher wants to shoot in the rain. you can adjust settings well with this on top of camera
customer_reviews.author: Antonio G

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof but bad fit.
customer_reviews.text: It's made for a camera with a 8 inch lens. I have to fold it over for it to not block my screen with my canon 10-18 , I have had to used several times on the Oregon coast. It's a pain in the butt but it worked and I got some amazing photos. Someday I'll find one that actually fits my 70d
customer_reviews.author: georgia

customer_reviews.title: Good option for protecting your expensive equipment
customer_reviews.text: These camera covers are always a compromise, but this one does a pretty decent job. I used it at the 2015 Petit Le Mans and it did a great job of protecting my camera and allowing me to continue shooting. It's a little awkward, but that comes with having to protect the camera and allow you to get to the controls. I used it with both my 23-105 and 100-400 lenses and it worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Ellsom

customer_reviews.title: Good Rain Cover for the price.
customer_reviews.text: It fits perfect with my Canon 5 Mark II using a wide lense and Long lense, made of a good quality waterproof material, fast and easy to put on. Used it in the Olympic Park RainForest, which might be dry and suddenly you get a bucket of water over you. Only problem I encounter it was that it got really hard to see through the clear plastic as it fog up easily, I know its physics but I don't know if they could treat it with a antifog material so it will not fog up. Other than that I recommend it, for the price is a good product.
customer_reviews.author: DAVID DEUTSCH

customer_reviews.title: I also like that it will wrap tightly around the lens
customer_reviews.text: This is a very well made product. It will fit most digital SLR camera's. I chose this over the clear poly ones because it just looked sturdier. I also like that it will wrap tightly around the lens. I live in a humid and windy climate so I was looking for something to protect the camera from blowing sand, dust and rain. I think this will work out well for me.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia A. Heere

customer_reviews.title: This one came and they seemed to have made some improvements which is great. The first one I had worked good
customer_reviews.text: I have the previous version of this product and it works quite well. I was bringing a second camera out to Washington for an outdoor event and figured I should order a second cover. This one came and they seemed to have made some improvements which is great. The first one I had worked good, this one works great. The bit that adjusts around the lens cover works much better on this version.
customer_reviews.author: Matt S.

customer_reviews.title: It's not bad, as far as rain covers go.
customer_reviews.text: I can't wait for the day that they make rain cover/weather protectants for cameras that are also convenient. Sigh. Clunky - but it does the job much better than some others I've tried. The fabric is a bit stiff and hard to work with. Hard to see through the clear pane in the back and I worry it will get hard and crack (it has not yet but I've only used it twice).
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Cash

customer_reviews.title: Useful... but for video will take getting use too
customer_reviews.text: Not bad at all. My need for this was to film a sports game. It held up quite well but needing to zoom in and out with my big hands takes getting use too and also you can hear the scruffingly sounds ever so often. Used it on an 80D with a battery grip and Canon 70-200mm mark ii...
customer_reviews.author: Ken Honore (Direct Kenx)

customer_reviews.title: Seems well made but not field tested yet.
customer_reviews.text: I was in wind and constant rain the week before I ordered this product using a trash bad and umbrella so I ordered this. It's cool but it could be slightly bigger for me to reach in to focus my lens. A cool add on would be a small plastic piece that could attach by velcro somehow over the top part of the lens. Other than that I have not field tested yet in bad weather but as soon as I do I'll add to this post. So far I can comment on how it doesn't seem like a piece of cheap plastic. It seems well made and I can't wait to test it out.
customer_reviews.author: jason janes

customer_reviews.title: Rain !! What rain Altura Photo has me covered!!
customer_reviews.text: Altura Photo carries a large amount of products for your DSLR needs. Great Rain Cover for those last minute rain showers.. Full use of DSLR no restrictions. Would definitely recommend to a friend..
customer_reviews.author: Cubandread

customer_reviews.title: Camera rain cover
customer_reviews.text: Since my last review was deleted by the company that sent this to me, I'll try again. This cover was bought for my Canon 20D. It has a hard time staying attached to the short lens and maneuvering it through the hand holes, is a bit difficult. The clear portion is not large enough to see the dials on top of the camera without moving the camera around inside the bag. I did have better luck when I used a longer lens, with the bag fitting better, but still had problem with the view of the top of the camera. I'll keep it just in case I see a storm coming and can't get to my backpak.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Willey

customer_reviews.title: Loved it.
customer_reviews.text: I was so glad to have this rain cover for my Nikon D750 on my trip to Hawaii. Rain showers came and went but my camera didn’t get wet and I could still take great pictures. Easy to use. Just remember to allow room for the flash to pop up.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon M Lake

customer_reviews.title: The material is a little stiff but works fine. I'm hoping it will loosen up over time
customer_reviews.text: The material is a little stiff but works fine. I'm hoping it will loosen up over time. It's hard to keep anything dry in the rain and this product achieves that. I use it only when I have to.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised. Seems to be made well. Good value.
customer_reviews.text: I used this to protect my Sony A7RII with 70-200 f2.8 GM attached during a transit of the Panama Canal. The fit was a little snug, but it protected my camera and lens perfectly during an hour or two of torrential rain at the end of our Canal transit.
customer_reviews.author: Leo Q.

customer_reviews.title: Caution -- definitely not for medium-sized DSLRs or if you're not using a tripod
customer_reviews.text: The company's Youtube video is clear that this is for a large lens DSLR standing on a tripod. Alas, the Amazon description doesn't say that. I ordered this for my Nikon D40 with a 55/200 lens. This cover is way too big and bulky. The lens strap doesn't work well, which you can tell by the fact that there are so many questions on the Amazon page on how to use it. Overall, if you have a large DSLR with a large lens, you'll probably enjoy this. But for anything else, beware.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Fellini

customer_reviews.title: I successfully used it in the cloud & rain forests of Costa Rica!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for protection for my camera. I am often out in the forests for Costa Rica where "when it rains, it RAINS". This item has worked great for me.
customer_reviews.author: Roy Prendas-Álvarez

customer_reviews.title: Great rain cover for my cameras
customer_reviews.text: Can't believe how cheap the price is on this. Looked at quite a few rain covers and this has the best reviews. I finally got to use this in Michigan last week (UP). It worked so well. It fits my Nikon D3s well. But, my Hasselblad H4D is a bit of a tighter fit but, it still worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Giordano

customer_reviews.title: Better than anticipated...
customer_reviews.text: Quick, Fast and Easy to cover cameras as advertised. Easy cleaning as well.. Never leave home without it. Always in my bag close.
customer_reviews.author: cheryl gaspard

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE! okay soit has not rained since I bought this, so I will update when it does and I am using it, but for now lt me say this is WAY nicer than I had thought it would be. It is well made and does not look like it will easily rip, as with previous ones I have bought. The sizing will work with y Cannon 7d and battery pack. I am very happy so far with the quality and fit.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica Mendes Brown

customer_reviews.title: Works really good...
customer_reviews.text: Why only four stars...frankly it's clumsy to use and it is a little small for full frame cameras. I would also recommend that they make the Velcro strap that secures the sleeve to the camera, be sewn to the lens sleeve. I have already lost the one they supplied. I used this rain cover in a steady down pour at a high school football game and my camera stayed dry. I recommend it if you don't mind removing the battery pack from your camera. It simply will not fit my 5D Mk ll with the battery pack attached. It will not zip across the bottom even without the pack.
customer_reviews.author: Totewell

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the hassle
customer_reviews.text: Very bulky and uncomfortable. Kept my camera dry but almost couldn't get it on over my 17-40mm lens. Also I have no idea what the velcro strap is for--it was constantly in my photos and I had to remember to hold it to the side. Also my gloves kept getting stuck to the velcro. The clear plastic is nice and thick but the rain cover in general is so big that it was very difficult to position the clear plastic over the viewfinder. Not worth the hassle--it'll be going in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Marti R

customer_reviews.title: Fits
customer_reviews.text: Fits my D750 with 70-200 2.8 well, even had room to tuck my camera strap in the bottom. Zooming is a little bit of a hassle, but worth it to keep my gear dry.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Hawley

customer_reviews.title: Protection from spray
customer_reviews.text: I needed something for a whale watching trip to keep mist and spray off my Nikon. Worked beautifully. I did not take any pictures while the cover was on.
customer_reviews.author: Westside mom

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera rain hood
customer_reviews.text: There isn’t anything I don’t love about this well made camera rain hood and you can’t beat the price!
customer_reviews.author: Scooby777

customer_reviews.title: TOP QUALITY - Very nice!!
customer_reviews.text: Just got mine today and the very FIRST thing you notice is the thickness and quality. VERY well made. I was wondering if it would fit my main rig which is a Nikon Pro body with 70-200 VRII lens. I have attached the photos of the test fit. As a nature photographer this product for the price could be one of my best purchases.
customer_reviews.author: heybrent

customer_reviews.title: Looks like it will work perfectly and fits my camera great
customer_reviews.text: Looks like it will work perfectly and fits my camera great. Haven't had an opportunity to use it in the rain (thank goodness we've had good luck with rain not falling when we want to take pictures) but I'm glad to have it in my kit.
customer_reviews.author: Amy M

customer_reviews.title: SIMPLE CLEVER IDEA
customer_reviews.text: But then, aren't the best ideas simple. Easy to use, well made and should meet the needs of most DSLR users. Clear vinyl material over camera body. Two layers of black vinyl over the lens area to increase water resistance. Lens area is loose enough to accommodate large hands and allow manual focusing from the inside or outside. A lens hood would help protect the camera lens from wind driven rains. For long exposure to rain, may want to apply Scotch Guard to the exterior of the black vinyl area.
customer_reviews.author: Baby Sumo

customer_reviews.title: Just use a ziploc bag
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a trip to Iceland to use in the rain/around waterfalls. It was hard to use and way too big for my DSLR (I have a Nikon D5300 so not the biggest DSLR out there but a pretty average-sized DSLR) so I had to roll back the front piece where the lens goes a lot and it kept slipping around and was very difficult to take pictures with. After struggling with it for awhile, I eventually just used a large ziploc bag. Wish I could return it.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, but a bit bulky to manage
customer_reviews.text: This definitely kept the rain off of my gear. I had plenty of opportunities this year to put it to the test. My only issue was that when cinched on the front end of the lens, I couldn't zoom...if I left it loose, it wandered into shots.
customer_reviews.author: mommazon

product_meta.title: Altura Photo Professional Rain Cover for Canon Nikon Sony DSLR Mirrorless Cameras
feature_bullets: Altura Photo Professional Rain Cover Protector for DSLR Cameras
Designed to protect and shield your small or professional DSLR camera and lens from rain, snow, salt spray, and any other unexpected weather conditions.
Made from high quality waterproof nylon with an ultra-clear viewing window.
Dual adjustable sleeves and full-length double zipper provides access to camera controls whether holding or tripod mounting your camera.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,538 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
